main event: Many flare-like objects of burning copper color were observed descending but burning out before reaching the ground in Marion, Indiana in September 1960.
interesting points: The objects were described as 8 or 9 in number and seemed to indicate they were receiving low-level radiations before burning out.
The objects were considered to be of possible Russian origin and exhibiting characteristics of a craft or device conducting electronic surveillance.
The sighting lasted for about 3 minutes.
The observer was unable to estimate the speed or distance of the objects.
The Air Force concluded the sighting was possibly a balloon, aircraft, or meteor.
sighted object: many flare-like objects of burning copper color
